H0.text: Waste from nuclear power plants is one of the main causes of acid rain.

H1.text: Spills from chemical manufacturing plants are one of the main causes of acid rain.

H2.text: Gases from burning fossil fuels are one of the main causes of acid rain.

H3.text: Gases from aerosol spray cans are one of the main causes of acid rain.

A4.text: The principal cause of acid rain is sulfur and nitrogen compounds from human sources, such as electricity generation, animal agriculture, factories, and motor vehicles.

A5.text: Combustion of fuels and smelting of some ores produce sulfur dioxide and nitric oxides.
